questions.text: A 30-Year-old female delivered a full-term female neonate with the help of vacuum extraction. The paediatrician evaluating the newborn for the first time a few minutes after the birth noticed a diffuse, boggy swelling in the scalp region. Which of the following is not the finding in this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It generally crosses the suture line

options.label: C
options.text: It usually occurs after the rupture of membranes

options.label: D
options.text: With increasing flexion, the swelling will be placed more posteriorly

questions.correct_answer: B. It disappears spontaneously within 2-3 weeks
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It disappears spontaneously within 2-3 weeks In the given question, the likely condition the newborn is having is caput succedaneum . It occurs due to the stagnation of fluid in the layer of the scalp beneath the girdle of contact. It is present at birth and normally resolves spontaneously within 24 hours .

Highyeild:

CEPHALHEMATOMA CAPUT SUCCEDANEUM Soft, fluctuant, localized swelling Localized soft tissue edema with a poorly defined outline Caused by subperiosteal haemorrhage Caused by the pressure of the fetal head against the cervix Appears after birth Present at birth Swelling does not cross suture lines Swelling crosses suture lines Disappears in several weeks to months Disappears within a few hours to days Complications include defective blood clotting, jaundice Complications are rare

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option A. It can cross the suture line as it is present between the scalp layer, unlike cephalhematoma which is present between the periosteum and the bone. Option C. It occurs due to stagnation of fluid due to interference with venous return and lymphatic drainage from an unsupported area of the scalp during the time of descent. MIT usually occurs after the rupture of membranes. Option D. Caput location signifies the position of the head occupied in the pelvis and the degree of flexion achieved. With increasing flexion, the swelling will be placed more posteriorly.

questions.text: A 22-Year-old female with 39 weeks POG presented for a routine checkup. On further examination following findings were noted: membranes intact, cervix 20% dilated, effacement - 1 cm. On palpating fetal parts, you are able to feel supraorbital ridges and anterior fontanel. And the head is partially extended. Her previous pregnancy is significant for brow presentation. What is the most appropriate management for the given scenario?

options.label: B
options.text: Wait for the progress of labour and allow NVD

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Elective C-section In the given question the patient has a previous history of brow presentation. Also in the present pregnancy on PV, the fetal part felt are supraorbital ridges and anterior fontanelle which points towards brow presentation. Hence this becomes a case of persistent brow presentation. So the most appropriate management will be a C-section.

questions.text: A 30 -Year-old primigravida at 40 weeks POG presented with abdominal pain and uterine contractions and delivered a male baby via assisted forceps delivery due to maternal distress and prolonged second stage of labour. The infant was normal at birth. A few hours later, you observe a circumscribed, soft fluctuant swelling on the scalp of the fetus which was not crossed by the suture lines. Which of the following statements is false regarding the given condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It can cause hyperbilirubinemia when extensive and may need a blood transfusion

options.label: B
options.text: Ventouse application does not increase the incidence of the given condition

options.label: C
options.text: It is never present at birth and develops gradually in 12-24 hours

questions.explanation:
Solution:

None of the above In the given clinical scenario, there is a prolonged second stage of labour which requires the application of forceps. This points towards birth trauma which could have been sustained due to forceps. Hence the given condition is cephalhematoma.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. It can cause hyperbilirubinemia when extensive and may need a blood transfusion. Option: B. It is the collection of blood between the periosteum and cranium, usually unilateral and over the parietal bone . It is more commonly due to forceps delivery but can also occur in normal labour. Ventouse application does not increase the incidence of the given condition. Option: C. It is never present at birth and develops gradually in 12-24 hours. The swelling is limited by the suture lines of the skull.

questions.text: While taking the class of 3rd year MBBS students by an OBG junior resident, on the fetal skull, one of your batchmates asks about the importance of the following structure marked in the given image below. Which of the following is the correct option regarding this? Its palpation on internal examination denotes the degree of flexion of the head. It facilitates the moulding of the head Through this, we can also do fetal scalp ph monitoring In cases of dehydration, on palpation, the floor is elevated and in intracranial tension, the floor is depressed. Select the correct answer from given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, 3 In the given image, the marked structure is the anterior fontanelle. It is formed by the joining of the four sutures in the midplane, anteriorly frontal, posteriorly sagittal and on either side coronal. This contributes to it being a diamond shape . The floor is formed by a membrane which becomes ossified 18 months after birth . It becomes pathological, if it fails to ossify even after 24 months.

Highyeild:

As it remains membranous long after birth, it helps in accommodating marked brain growth. Collection of blood and exchange transfusion can be performed through it via the superior longitudinal sinus. CSF can be drawn although rarely through the angle of the anterior fontanel from the lateral ventricle. Option 1: Its palpation on internal examination denotes the degree of flexion of the head. Option 2: Facilitates the moulding of the head. Option 3: Through this, we can also do fetal scalp ph monitoring. Option 4: In cases of dehydration, on palpation the floor is depressed and in intracranial tension, the floor is elevated.

questions.text: You are having your obstetric rotation as a part of your internship. On your duty, 4 ladies are in active labour in the labour room. Which of the following will have the largest skull diameter engaged?

options.label: A
options.text: 24-year-old primigravida with complete flexion attitude of the fetal head

options.label: B
options.text: 30-year-old female with the attitude of the fetal head as a complete extension

options.label: C
options.text: 22-year-old female with marked deflexion of the fetal head

options.label: D
options.text: 31-year-old female with a partial extension of the fetal head

questions.correct_answer: D. 31-year-old female with a partial extension of the fetal head
questions.explanation:
Solution:

31-year-old female with a partial extension of the fetal head In the given question, integrated knowledge of the diameter of the fetal skull along with the attitude of the fetal head in which they are found is important to understand. As asked in the question the largest diameter of the fetal skull, is mentovertical diameter which is 14 cm. Hence we need to find the option in which the attitude of the head corresponds to this diameter. 31-year-old female with the partial extension of the fetal head- the diameter involved is mentovertical which is 14cm.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. 24-year-old primigravida with complete flexion attitude of the fetal head- the engaging diameter will be suboccipitobregmatic which is 9.5cm. Option: B. 30-year-old female with an attitude of the fetal head as a complete extension. The engaging diameter will be submentobregmatic which is 9.5cm. Option: C. 22-year-old female with marked deflexion of the fetal head. The engaging diameter will be occipitofrontal which is 11.5 cm.
